    PLATFORM APPS

      ASSET MANAGEMENT

    • CyberSecurity Asset Management (CSAM)

      See entire attack surface, continuously maintain your CMDB, and track EOL/EOS software

    • External Attack Surface Management (EASM) - New

      Gain an attacker’s view of your external internet-facing assets and unauthorized software

      • Vulnerability & Configuration Management

    • Vulnerability Management, Detection & Response (VMDR) - Most Popular

      Discover, assess, prioritize, and patch critical vulnerabilities up to 50% faster

    • Enterprise TruRisk Management (ETM) - New

      Consolidate & translate security & vulnerability findings from 3rd party tools

    • Web App Scanning (WAS)

      Automate scanning in CI/CD environments with shift left DAST testing

    • Cloud Workload Protection (CWP)

      Detect, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities in your cloud environment

      • Risk REMEDIATION

    • Patch Management (PM)

      Efficiently remediate vulnerabilities and patch systems

    • Custom Assessment and Remediation (CAR)

      Quickly create custom scripts and controls for faster, more automated remediation

      • Threat Detection and Response

    • Multi-Vector EDR

      Advanced endpoint threat protection, improved threat context, and alert prioritization

    • Context XDR

      Extend detection and response beyond the endpoint to the enterprise

      • Compliance

    • Policy Compliance

      Reduce risk, and comply with internal policies and external regulations with ease

    • File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)

      Reduce alert noise and safeguard files from nefarious actors and cyber threats

      • Cloud Security

    • TotalCloud (CNAPP)

      Cloud-Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP) for multi-cloud environment.

    • Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)

      Continuously discover, monitor, and analyze your cloud assets for misconfigurations and non-standard deployments.

    • Infrastructure as Code Security (IaC)

      Detect and remediate security issues within IaC templates

    • SaaS Security Posture Management (SSPM) - New

      Manage your security posture and risk across your entire SaaS application stack

    • Cloud Workload Protection (CWP)

      Detect, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities in your cloud environment

    • Cloud Detection and Response (CDR)

      Continuous real-time protection of the multi-cloud environment against active exploitation, malware, and unknown threats.

    • Container Security (CS)

      Discover, track, and continuously secure containers – from build to runtime

Cyber Risk Series | Cloud Security Edition | February 28 | Register Now

Microsoft security alert.

November 12, 2013

Advisory overview

Qualys Vulnerability R&D Lab has released new vulnerability checks in the Enterprise TruRisk Platform to protect organizations against 19 vulnerabilities that were fixed in 8 bulletins announced today by Microsoft. Customers can immediately audit their networks for these and other new vulnerabilities by accessing their Qualys subscription. Visit Qualys Security Blog to prioritize remediation.

Non-Qualys customers can audit their network for these and other vulnerabilities by signing up for a Qualys Free Trial, or by trying Qualys Community Edition.

Vulnerability details

Microsoft has released 8 security bulletins to fix newly discovered flaws in their software. Qualys has released the following checks for these new vulnerabilities:

  • Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities (MS13-088)

    Severity
    Urgent 5
    Qualys ID
    100169
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-088
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3871, CVE-2013-3908, CVE-2013-3909, CVE-2013-3910, CVE-2013-3911, CVE-2013-3912, CVE-2013-3914, CVE-2013-3915, CVE-2013-3916, CVE-2013-3917
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description
    Microsoft Internet Explorer is a graphical web browser developed by Microsoft and included as part of the Microsoft Windows operating systems.

    Microsoft Internet Explorer is affected by following vulnerabilities. Multiple memory corruption vulnerabilities that exists in the way that Internet Explorer improperly handles objects in memory. An attacker could host a specially crafted website designed to exploit these vulnerabilities through Internet Explorer and then convince a user to view the website.

    This security update is rated Critical for Internet Explorer 6, 7, 8, 9 10 and 11 on Windows clients and Moderate for Internet Explorer 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10 on Windows servers.

    Consequence
    An attacker who successfully exploited these vulnerabilities could execute arbitrary code on affected systems with elevated privileges.
    Solution

    Please refer to MS13-088 for details.

    Workaround:

    1. Set Internet and Local intranet security zone settings to "High" to block ActiveX Controls and Active Scripting in these zones
    2. Configure Internet Explorer to prompt before running Active Scripting or to disable Active Scripting in the Internet and Local intranet security zone

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS13-088 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 6)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems(Internet Explorer 6)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 6)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2012(Internet Explorer 10)
    MS13-088 Windows Server 2012 R2(Internet Explorer 11)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 9)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 6)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2(Internet Explorer 8)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Service Pack 3(Internet Explorer 6)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Service Pack 3(Internet Explorer 7)
    MS13-088 Windows XP Service Pack 3(Internet Explorer 8)

  • Microsoft Windows Graphics Device Interface Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS13-089)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    90921
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-089
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3940
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description
    The Graphics Device Interface (GDI) is a Microsoft Windows application programming interface and core operating system component responsible for representing graphical objects and transmitting them to output devices such as monitors and printers.

    The vulnerability is caused by an incorrect integer calculation that occurs when a Windows Write (.wri) file, containing a specially crafted image is opened via WordPad. When WordPad parses this malicious file, the Windows GDI improperly processes the specially crafted image, which causes the memory corruption allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.

    This security update is rated Critical for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.

    Consequence
    An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same rights as the current user. Users whose accounts are configured to have fewer user rights on the system could be less impacted than users who operate with administrative user rights.

    Solution
    Please visit MS13-089 for further information.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-089 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-089 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-089 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-089 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-089 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-089 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS13-089 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS13-089 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-089 Windows XP Service Pack 3

  • Microsoft Cumulative Security Update of ActiveX Kill Bits (MS13-090)

    Severity
    Urgent 5
    Qualys ID
    90923
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-090
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3918
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description
    A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the InformationCardSigninHelper Class ActiveX control, icardie.dll. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted web page. When a user views the web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution.

    Affected Software:
    Windows XP Service Pack 3
    Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems
    Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems and Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    Windows 7 for x64-based Systems and Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems and Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems and Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    Windows Server 2012
    Windows Server 2012 R2
    Windows RT
    Windows RT 8.1

    Consequence
    An attacker who successfully exploited these vulnerabilities could execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on affected systems.
    Solution
    Please refer to MS13-090 for details.

    Workaround:
    Users can set the kill bits for CLSIDs with value of 19916e01-b44e-4e31-94a4-4696df46157b, c2c4f00a-720e-4389-aeb9-e9c4b0d93c6f, and 53001f3a-f5e1-4b90-9c9f-00e09b53c5f1

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-090 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-090 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-090 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-090 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-090 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-090 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-090 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS13-090 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-090 Windows XP Service Pack 3

  • Microsoft Office Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS13-091)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    110225
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-091
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-0082, CVE-2013-1324, CVE-2013-1325
    CVSS Scores
    Base 9.3 / Temporal 7.7
    Description

    This security update resolves three privately reported vulnerabilities in Microsoft Office that could allow remote code execution if a specially crafted WordPerfect document file is opened in an affected version of Microsoft Office software.

    This security update is rated Important for supported editions of Microsoft Office 2003, Microsoft Office 2007, Microsoft Office 2010, Microsoft Office 2013, and Microsoft Office 2013 RT software.

    Consequence

    Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities are can allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

    Solution
    Please refer Microsoft's advisory MS13-091 for more details about patches.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2003 Service Pack 3
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2013 (32-bit editions)
    MS13-091 Microsoft Office 2013 (64-bit editions)

  • Microsoft Hyper-V Privilege Escalation Vulnerability (MS13-092)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    90922
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-092
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3898
    CVSS Scores
    Base 7.9 / Temporal 6.2
    Description

    Microsoft Hyper-V is a stand-alone product that provides a reliable and optimized virtualization solution enabling organizations to improve server use and reduce costs.

    Microsoft Hyper-V is affected by a privilege escalation vulnerability if an attacker passes a specially crafted function parameter in a hypercall from a running virtual machine to the hypervisor. Failed attempts might lead to denial of service.

    This security update is rated Important for Windows 8 for x64-based Systems and Windows Server 2012.

    Consequence

    Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can allow an attacker to execute code with higher privileges. Failed attempts might lead to denial to service.

    Solution
    Please refer Microsoft advisory MS13-092 for more details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-092 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-092 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-092 Windows Server 2012

  • Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver Information Disclosure Vulnerability (MS13-093)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    90919
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-093
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3887
    CVSS Scores
    Base 4.9 / Temporal 3.8
    Description
    The AFD component provides the "ancillary function driver," that supports Windows sockets applications and is contained in the afd.sys file. The afd.sys driver runs in kernel mode and manages the Winsock TCP/IP communications protocol.

    The vulnerability occurs when Windows permits excess data to be copied from kernel memory to user memory.

    Affected Versions:
    64-bit editions of Windows XP
    Windows Server 2003, Windows Vista
    Windows Server 2008, Windows 7
    Windows Server 2008 R2
    Windows 8
    Windows Server 2012

    This security update is rated Important.

    Consequence
    The vulnerability could allow information disclosure if an attacker logs on to an affected system as a local user and runs a specially crafted application designed to enable the attacker to obtain information from a higher-privileged account.
    Solution
    Please refer to MS13-093 for details.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-093 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-093 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-093 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-093 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-093 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2

  • Microsoft Outlook S/MIME Certificate Metadata Information Disclosure Vulnerability (MS13-094)

    Severity
    Critical 4
    Qualys ID
    110226
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-094
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3905
    CVSS Scores
    Base 5 / Temporal 3.7
    Description
    Microsoft Outlook is a personal information manager from Microsoft, available as a part of the Microsoft Office suite.

    An information disclosure vulnerability exists when Microsoft Outlook does not properly handle the expansion of Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) certificate metadata. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain system information, such as the IP address and open TCP ports, from the target system and other systems that share the network with the target system.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported editions of Microsoft Outlook 2007, Microsoft Outlook 2010, Microsoft Outlook 2013 and Microsoft Outlook 2013 RT.

    Consequence
    Successful exploitation by a remote unauthenticated attacker could allow access to sensitive system information such as the IP address and open TCP ports from the target system and other systems that share the network with the target system.

    Solution
    Patch:
    Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:

    Microsoft Security Bulletin MS13-094

  • Microsoft Windows Digital Signatures Denial of Service Vulnerability (MS13-095)

    Severity
    Serious 3
    Qualys ID
    90920
    Vendor Reference
    MS13-095
    CVE Reference
    CVE-2013-3869
    CVSS Scores
    Base 5 / Temporal 3.7
    Description
    The X.509 specification defines a standard for managing public keys through a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI).

    A denial of service vulnerability exists in the implementations of X.509 certificate parsing that could cause an affected web service to stop responding. The vulnerability occurs when the X.509 certificate validation operation fails to handle a specially crafted X.509 certificate.

    This security update is rated Important for all supported editions of Microsoft Windows.

    Consequence
    Successfully exploiting this vulnerability might allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service.
    Solution
    Refer to MS13-095 for further information.

    Patches:
    The following are links for downloading patches to fix these vulnerabilities:
    MS13-095 Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-095 Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-095 Windows 8 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-095 Windows 8 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-095 Windows 8.1 for 32-bit Systems
    MS13-095 Windows 8.1 for x64-based Systems
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2012
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS13-095 Windows Server 2012 R2
    MS13-095 Windows Vista Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2
    MS13-095 Windows XP Service Pack 3

These new vulnerability checks are included in Qualys vulnerability signature 2.2.577-3. Each Qualys account is automatically updated with the latest vulnerability signatures as they become available. To view the vulnerability signature version in your account, from the Qualys Help menu, select the About tab.

Selective Scan Instructions Using Qualys

To perform a selective vulnerability scan, configure a scan profile to use the following options:

  1. Ensure access to TCP ports 135 and 139 are available.
  2. Enable Windows Authentication (specify Authentication Records).
  3. Enable the following Qualys IDs:
    • 100169
    • 90921
    • 90923
    • 110225
    • 90922
    • 90919
    • 110226
    • 90920
  4. If you would like the scan to return the Windows Hostname, also include QID 82044 and ensure access to UDP port 137 is available.
  5. If you would like to be notified if Qualys is unable to log on to a host (if Authentication fails), also include QID 105015.

In addition, prior to running a scan for these new vulnerabilities, you can estimate your exposure to these new threats by running the Risk Analysis Report, available from the Qualys Vulnerability Management Reports tab.

About Qualys

The Enterprise TruRisk Platform and its integrated suite of security and compliance applications provides organizations of all sizes with a global view of their security and compliance solutions, while drastically reducing their total cost of ownership. Qualys solutions include: continuous monitoring, vulnerability management, policy compliance, PCI compliance, security assessment questionnaire, web application scanning, web application firewall, malware detection and SECURE Seal for security testing of web sites.

Is your web server's SSL/TLS configuration secure? Find out for free.

See the power of Qualys, instantly. We don’t use the domain names or the test results, and we never will.
